classes.cCustomNote: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, B4, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, Lower-Division E, Lower-Division F, and GE Elective. Courses in Upper-Division B and Upper-Division C should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to online catalog for GE course selection and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR).

Upper Division GE courses taken for a letter grade satisfy Major or Support course requirements which may require additional units of Free Electives to complete the 180 unit total degree requirement. Some free electives may need to be 300-400 level to ensure completion of required minimum 60 units of upper division. Consult college advisor for more information.
Choose one of the following: HIST210, HIST221, HIST222, or HIST223.

Any Upper Division Elective (Non-US / Non-European HIST) course can go here. Minimum of 12 units must be selected at the 400 level. HIST400, HIST467, HIST485, HIST495 cannot count towards the 24 units of History electives. Minimum of 12 units to be selected from Non-US, Non-European HIST courses (see catalog for list of options).
